content.description: Climb the line just left of the arete. Side-pull & under-cling your way to the top.
content.protection: Bolts to anchor. Anchor equipped for lowering.
content.location: This route is on the far right side of the [East facing?] wall around the right corner from Rain Dance.  Start on the slanted ledge by the large beach tree and follow the bolt line up.

content.description: A series of hard boulder problems down low lead to a rest before you attack the steep head wall with 5.12 terrain above.
content.location: Just left to the Rightmost line at the Oasis wall.

content.description: Same start and full meat crux of TOT but clip a different bolt out righ of the big anvil jug and trend up and right through another hard 5.12 crux to anchors near Dog Solider.

Techy but easy climbing follows a leaning crack system underneath the roof of the oasis. At around the 5'th bolt find the glorious kneebar to prep for the meat of the climb.  

  Bust out the rest with a strenuous pull to get you situated on the the steep face. From here follow amazing red river gorge style dishes and crimps to the top. 

  Quality line with every hold and move under the sun. Pure fun!
content.location: The obvious line that follows the crack at the oasis, but spits straight up instead of following it the whole way through.

content.description: Start on 8 Days and climb the bottom crux to the big anvil jug intersection of TOT. Don't clip the bolt of TOT but traverse another wingspan right and clip a right bolt and trend up and right finishing on Reservation.
content.location: Starts on 8 Days Straight and finishes on Reservation.

content.description: Follow the seam all the way up using burly body wrestling technique. Double kneebars are crucial
content.protection: Bolts and Permadraws. May need a couple draws to lengthen permadraws for rope drag.
content.location: Left most route at the Oasis wall

content.description: Brilliant bullet stone for the few 4 bolts and then things kinda fall apart and get softer and chossier going through the upper 1/2 of the route to the anchors. This route should get more traffic because it most likely will clean up and the sketchier choss will get cleaned off.
content.location: 15' Right of TOT on a pretty bullet face

content.description: From the rock stack, wiggle your way into the dirty chimney. Grovel your way past 4 bolts to a very low angled wall continuing towards the outside world. Two-bolt anchor is located on the main face above the detached part of the wall. Be aware that the low angle slab at the top is still very dirty and there may be some smaller loose blocks remaining from the initial cleaning. Belaying up your second from the ledge to enjoy the views of the valley is recommended!
content.location: About halfway from the Oasis to the Fire Wall look for where the ground starts dropping away from the cliff creating a roof about 4 feet off the ground. Hunch over and find your way to the hidden chimney between the main cliff and the gigantic detached part of the cliff.

content.description: At first this may seem like a link-up but really climbs well as a unique independent start and then finishes on TOT starting from the big jug at the end of the TOT crux.
content.location: Start on 2 independent bolts on the vertical face left of the start of Raindance/Ghostdance. Stickclip the first bolt. climb up and clip the ~3rd Perma on Raindance and then climb out right into a 12- crux then connect into TOT at the big anvil jug.

content.description:
Just right of the obvious waterfall after passing the tomb.  

  Contains a few steep climbs with very unique climbing styles for the state.
